newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria's Klima wins no-confidence vote.
newsitem.headline: Austria's Klima wins no-confidence vote.

text.p: Austrian Chancellor Viktor Klima on Thursday won a no-confidence vote called by the far-right Freedom Party over privatisation plans for the country's top bank, Bank Austria.
Parliament voted against the no-confidence vote in the Social Democrat chancellor by 115 to 35.

The vote was held after the nationalist far right condemned Klima for allegedly knowing that Germany's Westdeutsche Landesbank Girozentrale had acquired first refusal on a majority stake in state-controlled Bank Austria.
"I was not informed," Klima told deputies before the vote was called. "This search for scapegoats is damaging to Austria's banks and economy," he added.
But far-right leader Joerg Haider said: "You were fully informed."
WestLB in 1995 acquired a 10.7 percent voting stake in Bank Austria and a first refusal on the majority stake held by Vienna City holding company AVZ.
